turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Saavik, get us out, best speed!

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Aye, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Time from my mark...

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Two minutes, ten seconds.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Engine room! What's happening?!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Time!

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Three minutes, thirty seconds.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Distance from Reliant...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: After you dismiss the company, you will take the watch. Set course for Ceti Alpha V and we'll pick up survivors.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Aye, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I'll be in my quarters if needed, but I would prefer...

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Understood, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Dismiss the company.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Admiral on the bridge!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: As you were, Mr. Saavik.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Aye, sir. On course to Ceti Alpha. All is well.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Good, I believe you already know my, uh, son --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Yes, well, why don't you show him around and...

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Aye, sir --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I really must thank you.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: I am delighted; any chance to go aboard Enterprise, however briefly, is always an excuse for nostalgia.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I cut your new orders personally. By the end of the month, you'll have your first command: USS EXCELSIOR.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Thank you, sir. I've looked forward to this for a long time.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You've earned it. But I'm still grateful to have you at the helm for three weeks. I don't believe these kids can steer.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Stop engines.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Stop engines.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Course plotted for Regula I, Admiral...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Engage warp engines --

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Reliant in our section this quadrant, sir, and slowing --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Visual.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Sulu... The shields!

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Trying, sir!

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: I can't get power, sir!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Scotty!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Sulu, lock phasers on target and await my command...

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Phasers locked...

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Sir, you did it.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: <u>I did nothing</u> -- except get caught with my britches down. I must be senile. Mr. Saavik, you just keep right on quoting regulations. Meantime, let's find out what the hell is going on and see how bad we've been --

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Approaching Regula and Space Lab Regula I.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Try again.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Admiral on the bridge --

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Battle stations.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Phaser lock inoperative, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Best guess, Mr. Sulu. Fire when ready.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Leaving Section Fourteen for Section Fifteen.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Project parabolic course to avoid entering Neutral Zone.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Aye, Captain.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: May I remind the Captain that if a Starship enters the zone --

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: I'm aware of my responsibilities, Mister.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: ... Now entering the Neutral Zone...

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Shields activated!

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Inform the Klingons we are on a rescue mission...

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: We're over our heads. Mr. Sulu, get us out of here.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: I'll try, Captain.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Aft thrusters, Mr. Sulu.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Aft thrusters, sir.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: We are clear and free to navigate.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Course heading, Captain?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Prepare for warp speed.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Ready, sir.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: We commend the soul of our brother departed. We love we commit his body to the depths of space.

turns.speaker: SULU
turns.text: Honors -- hup!

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Fire all phasers...!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: No power to the weapons system, sir.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: He's not what I expected, Sir.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: What did you expect, Lieutenant?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: He's very human.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: We can't all be perfect, Saavik. You must control your prejudices and remember that as a Vulcan as well as a Romulan you are forever a stranger in an alien land. Around you are humans, and as a member of the Starfleet you are unlikely ever to escape their presence or their influence. You must learn to tolerance in addition to all else I have taught you. Tolerance is logical.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Very well, Mr. Saavik, clear all moorings.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Aye, sir.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: All moorings are clear, Captain.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Thank you, Mr. Saavik.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Lieutenant, how many times have you piloted a Starship out of Spacedock?

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Never, sir.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Take her out, Mr. Saavik.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Aye, sir.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Sir, may I quote General Order 12: 'On the approach of any vessel, when communications have not been est --

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Lieutenant, the Admiral is aware of the Regulations.

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: Aye, sir.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Certainly...

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: By the book...

turns.speaker: SAAVIK
turns.text: You lied.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I exaggerated.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I do not understand the final question...

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: You are half human. The Computer knows that.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: The question is irrelevant.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Spock... The retraining of your mind has been in the Vulcan way, so you may not understand feelings. But as my son, you have them. They will surface.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: As you wish, since you deem them of value. But I cannot wait here to find them.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Where must you go?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: To Earth. To offer testimony.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: You do this -- for friendship?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I do this because I was there,

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Spock. Does the good of the many outweigh the good of the one...?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I would accept that as an axiom.

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: Then you stand here alive because of a mistake -- made by your flawed, feeling, human friends. They have sacrificed their futures because they believed that the good of the <u>one</u> -- you -- was more important to them.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Humans make illogical decisions...

turns.speaker: AMANDA
turns.text: ... They do, indeed.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Heard there was some excitement.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Just a couple of kooks...

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: How're you doing?

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Fine. Just fine.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Don't tell me fish stories, kiddo. I've known you too long.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Bob... it's tearing me apart.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: I know. I feel the same thing. But we're between a rock and a hard place. We can't keep them without risking their lives and we can't let them go without a taking the same chance.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: And finally, they're not human beings, you know. Their intelligence has in no way been proven comparable to ours --

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: I don't know about you, but my compassion for someone is not limited to my estimate of their intelligence.  I mean whales may not have painted the Mona Lisa or invented the dirt bike but they didn't ravish the land either.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Sorry if I spoke out of turn.

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Not at all. You gave me things to think about. You always do. You do sound a little wrecked, why don't you go home and stare at the ceiling?

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Why don't I?

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: You -- sent them away. Without even letting me say goodbye?

turns.speaker: BOB
turns.text: Gillian --

turns.speaker: NICHOLS
turns.text: Professor Scott, I'm Dr. Nichols, plant manager. I'm terribly sorry but there's been an awful mix-up Would you believe I was never told about your visit?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: I tried to clear things up, Professor Scott. I explained you'd come all the way from Edinburgh on appointment to study manufacturing methods here at Plexico, but they don't seem to know anything about it.

turns.speaker: NICHOLS
turns.text: Well, so much for the tour of our humble plant. I must say, Professor your knowledge of engineering is most impressive.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Back home, we call him the miracle worker.

turns.speaker: NICHOLS
turns.text: Indeed... May I offer you gentlemen anything?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: He never jokes... Perhaps the professor could use your computer.

turns.speaker: NICHOLS
turns.text: Please...

turns.speaker: NICHOLS
turns.text: No!  No... What did you have in mind...?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: A moment alone, please.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: You'd think they could at least send a ship. Bad enough to be court marshaled and spend the rest of our lives mining borite -- but to come home in this Klingon flea trap...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: We could learn a thing or two from this flea trap. It has a cloaking device that cost us a lot.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: I just wish we could cloak the stench.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: You sure this is such a bright idea?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: I mean <u>him</u>, back at his post, like nothing happened. I don't know if you'd got the whole picture but he isn't exactly working on all thrusters.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: It'll come back to him.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Are you sure?  That's what I thought.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Sulu... Take us home...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Bones --

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Dammit, Jim, they've made him into a goddam green-blooded computer!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Bones, stay here.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: No way -- somebody has to keep an eye on him!

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Now wait just a damn minute.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Spock, start your computations for time warp.  Come on, Bones. Let's pay Scotty a visit.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: You're really going to try this time travel in this rust bucket?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: We've done it before.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Sure, slingshot around the Sun. If you pick up enough speed you're in time warp. If you don't, you fry..

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Would you prefer to do nothing?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: I prefer a dose of common sense. you are proposing to head backwards in time, find Humpback Whales, then bring them forward in time, drop them off - and hope they tell this Probe what to do with itself!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: -- That's the general idea.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: That's crazy!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: If you have a better idea - now's the time.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: It doesn't look all that different.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Let's hope so, Bones. Mr. Sulu, set us down in Golden Gate Park.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Oh, joy.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Captain Spock and I will attempt to trace these whale songs to their source.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Jim, you've got to let me go in there! Don't leave him in the hands of Twentieth Century medicine.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What do you think, Spock?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What did you say she was getting?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Cramps.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: An experimental device, doctor.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Tearing of the middle meningeal artery...

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Wake up, man, wake up!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Come on, Pavel...

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: He's coming 'round, Jim...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Pavel, can you hear me? Give me your name and rank...

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Congratulations, Jim. I think you've saved the Earth.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Not me, Bones... They did it.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Hi... Busy?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Uhura is busy. I am monitoring.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Umm. Well, just wanted to say -- nice to have your katra back in your head, not mine.  I mean, I may have carried your soul, but I sure couldn't fill your shoes.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: ... My shoes...

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Forget it...  How 'bout covering a little philosophical ground? Life, Death, Life... Things of that nature?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I did not have time on Vulcan to review the Philosophical disciplines.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Spock, it's me, Bones! I mean our experience was unique. You really have gone where no man has gone before. Can't you tell me what it felt like?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: It would be impossible to discuss the subject without a common frame of reference.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: You're joking...!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: A joke is a story with a humorous climax.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: You mean I have to die to discuss your insights on death?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Pardon me, Doctor, I am hearing many calls of distress.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Most unusual. An unknown form of energy of great intelligence and power. I find it illogical that its intentions are hostile...

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Really? You think this is its way of saying "Hi there" to the people of the Earth?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: There are millions of other species on Earth, Doctor. Only human arrogance would assume the message was meant for man.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: I liked him better before he died.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Specifically, Humpback Whales.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: That's crazy! Who would send a probe hundreds of light years to talk to a whale?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: 10 million years earlier. Humpbacks were heavily hunted by Man. They have been extinct since the 21st Century... It is possible that an alien intelligence sent the probe to determine why they lost contact.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: ... My God...

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: You just said there aren't any except on Earth of the past.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: That is what I said, Doctor.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Then how.?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Angels and ministers of grace, defend us.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Hamlet, Act I scene 4.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: You, ah...  You present the appearance of a man with a problem.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Your perception is correct, Doctor... In order to return us to the exact moment at which we left the 23rd Century, I have used our journey back through time as a referent, calculating the coefficient of elapsed time in relation to the acceleration curve.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Naturally.  So what is your problem?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Acceleration is no longer a constant.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Well, you're gonna have to take your best shot.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: ... Best shot...?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Guess, Spock. Your best guess.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: "Guessing" is not in my nature...

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Well nobody's perfect...

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: ... I don't think he understands...

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: No, Spock. It means he feels safer about your "guesses" than most other peoples facts.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: You're saying... It is a compliment.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: It is.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Who are you? Doctor Adams was supposed to assist me.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: We're just -- observing.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: I was not informed about observers.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: What the hell do you think you're doing?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Reading the patient's vital signs.

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: What's your degree in, dentistry?

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: How do you explain slowing pulse, low respiratory rate and coma?

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: Fundoscopic examination --

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: Fundoscopic examination is unrevealing in these cases!

turns.speaker: DOCTOR
turns.text: A simple evacuation of the expanding epidural hematoma will relieve the pressure.

turns.speaker: BONES
turns.text: My God, man, drilling holes in his head is not the answer. The artery must be repaired without delay or he will die! So put away your butcher knives and let me save the patient!

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: What's causing that!?

turns.speaker: SCIENCE OFFICER
turns.text: Captain, their call is being carried on an amplification wave of enormous power!

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Can you isolate the wave?

turns.speaker: SCIENCE OFFICER
turns.text: Negative. It's impacting on all our systems!

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: Damage report!

turns.speaker: SCIENCE OFFICER
turns.text: Captain... All systems have failed... We are functioning on reserve power only.

turns.speaker: CAPTAIN
turns.text: We're out of control -- Rig for collision...

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: Find it?

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Yes, under "U.S. Government." Now we need directions.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Team leader, this is team 2.   Come in, please...

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: I have the coordinates of the reactor...

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: ... It gives me a great sense of history.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: It gives me a great sense of danger. We have to beam in next to the reactor room, not in it.

turns.speaker: UHURA
turns.text: How long?

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Depends on how much shielding is between us and the reactor.

turns.speaker: FBI AGENT
turns.text: All right, Commander, you wanna tell us anything?

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Like what?

turns.speaker: FBI AGENT
turns.text: Like who you really are and what you're doing here and what this thing is.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: My name is Pavel Chekov. I am a Lt. Commander in Starfleet, United Federation of Planets, service number 656-5827b.

turns.speaker: FBI AGENT
turns.text: All right. Let's take it from the top.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: The top of what?

turns.speaker: FBI AGENT
turns.text: Name?

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: My name?

turns.speaker: FBI AGENT
turns.text: No, <u>my</u> name.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: I do not know your name.

turns.speaker: FBI AGENT
turns.text: You play games with me and you're through

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: I am? May I go now?

turns.speaker: FBI AGENT
turns.text: Okay... Make nice and give us the ray gun.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: I varn you. If you don't lie on the floor, I vill have to stun you.

turns.speaker: FBI AGENT
turns.text: Go ahead. Stun me.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: I'm wery sorry, but --

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Operational, Admiral. Cloaking Device now available in all modes of flight.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I'm impressed, Mr. Chekov. A lot of effort for a short voyage.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: We are in an enemy wessel, sir. I didn't wish to be shot down on thee way to our own funeral.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Most prudent.  Engine room. Report, Scotty.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: No, sir. And no Federation wessels on assigned patrol stations.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: That's odd. Uhura, what's on the Comm channels...?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Shields, Mr. Chekov.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Shields, aye.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: May fortune favor the foolish.  Mr. Sulu, Warp Speed!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: No choice now, Scotty!

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Sir, heat shields at maximum!

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Yes, sir.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Dr. McCoy, you, Mr. Scott and Commander Sulu will convert us a whale tank.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Ah, well done, team 2.

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: And Admiral, it's the Enterprise.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Understood. What is your plan?

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: Cloaking device is stable... All systems normal.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Stabilize Energy Reserve!... Report helm:

turns.speaker: CHEKOV
turns.text: The mains are down, sir! Aux power is not responding.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Mr. Sulu, switch to manual control!

turns.speaker: COUNCIL PRESIDENT
turns.text: Status report, Admiral!

turns.speaker: MORROW
turns.text: Mr. President, the Probe has passed through all quadrants. The starships Shepard and Yorktown and three smaller vessels have been neutralized.

turns.speaker: COUNCIL PRESIDENT
turns.text: "Neutralized?" How?

turns.speaker: MORROW
turns.text: We don't know. It's using forms of energy our best scientists do not understand...

turns.speaker: COUNCIL PRESIDENT
turns.text: Can you protect us?

turns.speaker: MORROW
turns.text: We are launching everything we have.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: To hunt a species to extinction is not logical.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Whoever said the human race was logical?  Now if you'll follow me, I'll introduce you to the Institute's pride and joy.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Attempting the hell to communicate.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Communicate? Communicate what? You have no right to be here!

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: They like you very much. But they are not the hell your whales.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: I suppose they told you that...?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: The hell they did.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: So you were at Berkeley.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: I was not.

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Are you sure it isn't time for a colorful metaphor?

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: You're not one of those guys from the military, are you? Trying to teach whales to retrieve torpedoes, or some dipshit stuff like that?

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: You sure you won't change your mind?

turns.speaker: SPOCK
turns.text: Is there something wrong with the one I have?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: You mean man...

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: To put it mildly. Since the dawn of time, men have harvested whales for a variety of purposes, most of which can be achieved synthetically at this point. A hundred years ago, using hand-thrown harpoons, they did plenty of damage -- but that was nothing compared to what they've achieved in this century.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: They are mature humpbacks, weighing 45,000 pounds each. They wandered into San Francisco Bay as calves and were brought here. We call them George and Gracie.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: It's perfect, Spock: a male, a female, together in a contained space can beam them up together and consider ourselves damn lucky...

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Despite all the things they are teaching us we have to return George and Gracie to the open sea.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Why's that?

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Well, for one thing, we simply don't have the money to keep feeding them a couple of tons of shrimp a day!

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: How soon?

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Soon... It's too bad because they're very friendly as you can see. I've grown quite attached to them... This way.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Ohhh<u>kay</u>. I don't know what this is about, but I want you guys outta here right now or I call the cops.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: I assure you that won't be necessary. We were only trying to help...

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: The hell you were, buster. Your friend was messing up my tank and messing up my whales...

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Back to San Francisco.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Came all the way down here to jump in and swim with the kiddies, huh?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: There's really very little point in my trying to explain.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: I buy that. What about him?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: He's harmless.  Back in the sixties he was part of the Free Speech movement at Berkeley. I think he did too much LDS.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: LDS?? Are you dyslexic on top of everything else? Come on, Lemme give you a lift. I have a notorious weakness for hard luck cases -- that's why I work with whales.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: We don't want to be any trouble.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: You've already been that. C'mon.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Don't mention it. And don't try anything, either. I got a tire iron right where I can get at it.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Memory problems, too.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Uh huh. What about you? Where you from?

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Iowa.

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: A landlubber. Come on, what the hell were you boys really trying to do back there? Was it some kinda macho thing? If that's all, I'm gonna be real disappointed. I hate that macho type.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: Can I ask <u>you</u> something?

turns.speaker: GILLIAN
turns.text: Go ahead.

turns.speaker: KIRK
turns.text: What's going to happen when you release the whales?
